top_signals.headline: Bank Indonesia Holds BI-Rate at 5.75% to Support Rupiah Stability
top_signals.impact: The central bank maintained its benchmark rate amid global uncertainty, balancing growth support with currency stability. Foreign reserves remain robust at $151.8B, providing FX intervention capacity.

top_signals.headline: JCI Index Resilient Above 7,200 as Foreign Flows Turn Positive
top_signals.impact: Jakarta Composite Index maintains strength driven by banking and consumer sectors. Net foreign buying resumed as EM sentiment improves on Fed pivot expectations. YTD performance +2.3%.

top_signals.headline: Indonesia Q3 GDP Grows 5.12% YoY, Beats Consensus Estimates
top_signals.impact: Economic expansion driven by household consumption (+4.9%) and fixed investment (+5.1%). Manufacturing PMI at 52.3 signals continued expansion. Full-year growth projected at 5.05-5.15%.

top_signals.headline: Federal Reserve Signals Potential December Rate Cut Amid Cooling Inflation
top_signals.impact: FOMC minutes suggest committee members see conditions for further easing. Core PCE trending toward 2.5% target. Markets pricing 65% probability of 25bp cut in December.

top_signals.headline: Indonesian Rupiah Stabilizes at 15,850/USD on Trade Surplus
top_signals.impact: Currency finds support from continued trade surplus ($10.5B Q3) and BI intervention. Carry trade dynamics remain favorable vs USD. Key resistance at 16,000 level.

top_signals.headline: Indonesian Banks Report Strong NIM Expansion in Q3 Results
top_signals.impact: Major banks (BBCA, BBRI, BMRI) posted 12-15% earnings growth with NIMs expanding to 5.2-5.8%. Loan growth accelerated to 11.5% YoY. NPL ratios stable at 2.1-2.4%.

top_signals.headline: S&P 500 Approaches All-Time High on AI Optimism and Rate Cut Bets
top_signals.impact: Index trading near 6,000 level as tech sector leads. Magnificent 7 stocks contribute 60% of YTD gains. Earnings growth re-accelerating to +8% YoY in Q4.

top_signals.headline: US 10-Year Treasury Yield Falls to 4.35% on Dovish Fed Outlook
top_signals.impact: Bond yields decline as markets reprice Fed trajectory. Real yields at +2.0% remain attractive for fixed income allocations. Duration positioning shifts to neutral.

top_signals.headline: China Manufacturing PMI Expands to 51.5, Supporting EM Sentiment
top_signals.impact: Factory activity strengthens on stimulus measures and export recovery. Positive read-through for Asian supply chains and commodity demand. EM currencies rally.

top_signals.headline: Brent Crude Holds at $78/bbl as OPEC+ Maintains Production Discipline
top_signals.impact: Oil prices stabilize on balanced supply-demand outlook. OPEC+ compliance remains high at 95%. Inventory levels normalize. Range-bound trading expected near term.

top_signals.headline: Nearly a quarter of Americans say their credit scores took a hit this year—the No. 1 way to increase yours, according to an expert
top_signals.impact: If your credit score has taken a hit this year, there isn't much you can do to erase your history, but there are steps you can take to rebuild your credit.

top_signals.headline: U.S. economy grows by 4.3% in third quarter, much more than expected, delayed report shows
top_signals.impact: The U.S. economy grew at a much bigger-than-expected pace in the third quarter, boosted by strong consumer spending, a delayed report released Tuesday showed.

top_signals.headline: U.S. economy grew 4.3% before government shutdown, GDP shows, in biggest gain in 2 years
top_signals.impact: The U.S. grew at a snappy 4.3% annual pace in the third quarter — the biggest increase in two years — but the economy is unlikely to match that feat in the waning months of 2025 due partly to the long government shutdown.

top_signals.headline: RadNet (NASDAQ:RDNT) Trading Down 3.5% - Time to Sell?
top_signals.impact: RadNet (NASDAQ:RDNT) shares fell 3.5% on Monday with significantly lower trading volume, closing at $73.99. Despite a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating and an average price target of $87.60 from analysts following several upgrades, some analysts and Weiss Ratings remain negative. The company reported

top_signals.headline: Holiday retail spending rose 4.2% this season, driven by e-commerce and electronics: Visa report
top_signals.impact: U.S. holiday retail spending rose 4.2% as consumers spent more on tech and apparel, with online sales jumping 7.8%, Visa data shows, despite higher prices.

top_signals.headline: SLB Earnings Preview: What to Expect
top_signals.impact: SLB N.V. (SLB) is set to announce its Q4 2025 results on January 23rd, with analysts expecting an adjusted EPS of $0.74, a decrease from the previous year. Despite a Q3 beat, shares fell due to management's cautious outlook on North American drilling activity and operational softness. Analysts curre

top_signals.headline: EV realism is here. How automakers react in 2026 will be telling
top_signals.impact: Detroit automakers are refocusing on large gas-guzzling trucks and SUVs, and many have admitted that policies, not consumers, were driving the charge for EVs.

top_signals.headline: FDA approves first GLP-1 pill for obesity from Wegovy maker Novo Nordisk
top_signals.impact: The approval gives Novo Nordisk a head start over chief rival Eli Lilly, which is racing to launch its own obesity pill.

top_signals.headline: Paramount guarantees Larry Ellison backing in amended WBD bid
top_signals.impact: Paramount notably did not increase its bid on Monday, reiterating that it believes the deal is superior to Netflix's.

top_signals.headline: Nike gets named a top pick at Jefferies — plus, what's next for Starbucks stock
top_signals.impact: Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.

top_signals.headline: Powerball's $1.6 billion jackpot is its fourth largest ever—here's the after-tax payout in every U.S. state
top_signals.impact: Powerball's jackpot has grown to the fourth largest ever in U.S. lottery history.

top_signals.headline: A closely watched gauge of bond-market volatility is signaling all-clear for stocks
top_signals.impact: November wasn’t exactly a great month for the U.S. stock market, although the S&P 500 did manage to eke out a small gain. So far, December is shaping up to be only modestly better.

top_signals.headline: GDP looks strong despite a turbulent year. Can the U.S. economy keep it up?
top_signals.impact: The kitchen sink was thrown at the economy in 2025 — punishing tariffs, higher inflation, rising unemployment — but the U.S. might still be growing at an above-average speed in a sign of surprising pluck.

top_signals.headline: Why Warner Bros. Discovery shareholders might opt for Paramount's offer — and why they might not
top_signals.impact: WBD shareholders must weigh pros and cons of tendering their shares to Paramount for $30 per share. CNBC lays out the arguments on both sides.

top_signals.headline: The NBA is pursuing ownership groups for a potential basketball league in Europe
top_signals.impact: The NBA is exploring the launch of a new professional men’s league in Europe in partnership with FIBA.
